creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: two owls perched on a chestnut tree branch; owl at L has eyes shut, owl at R has eyes wide open; green and brown autumnal leaves and chestnuts surround; moon rising at LL
marks: Left: [一九七Ｏ年作　ふくろう] {1970nen saku, fukurō}; bottom LRC: [遠志] {Tōshi}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Two Owls
